intro: Turraeanthus bracteolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved turraeanthus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
